docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: 12 ml borosilicate glass vial (Labco 9RK8)
  • Sample size: 100–200 µg
  • Sequence (standards 16 + samples 50): Carrara Z × 3, Fletton clay, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Fletton clay, Carrara Z × 3

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: 0.75 ml borosilicate glass vial (Kimble 60831D-830) +
  • Sample size: 20–100 µg
  • Sequence (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: 1 ml borosilicate glass vial (WHEATON W986284NG) + black cap + blue septa (Analytical Columns C234115)
  • Sample size: 100–150 µg
  • Sequence (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3

docs.title: Monday
docs.text:
1. Prep-Water trap chiller on
  2. AC, ML, MH
  3. 45–60 mins
  4. Test acid drop
    1. Put tissue under needle
    2. Prep-Dispense acid
    3. Check acid drop after ~5 mins. If not, repeat the last step.

docs.title: Monday to Thursday
docs.text:
1. Flush sample needle with He gas
    1. Prep–Move Gilson to next vial. If Gilson does not move: Prep–Initialise Gilson, then try again.
    2. AB, MH
    3. Check: AD
    4. AE
    5. Connect He gas, open cylinder valve, open regulator valve
    6. Wipe off acid
    7. Check flow rate through the needle
    8. Disonnect He gas
  2. Pump out
    1. Put on an old vial on needle
    2. ML, AD, until ML vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    3. Prep–Initialise Gilson
  3. Remove old vial
  4. AB, ML
  5. MH (auto ML)
  6. Change old sample vials in the heater block into new sample vials
  7. Replenish reference gas
    1. LV, RP, RV
    2. Set bellow to 1400
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    4. RM
    5. Check SP
    6. RI
    7. Manually operate 2 toggle valves (upper, lower) on reference gas cylinder
      1. L: pump out reference gas between the two valves 30s
      2. L, U: release reference gas 30s
      3. LV
      4. U, L: replenish reference gas 30s
      5. L
    8. RI, RP
    9. Set bellow to 0, until bellow fully open
    10. RM
    11. Check 44 ≈ 2.5e-9
  8. Test–Peak center
  9. Close scan

  10. Update sample table in batch MPRPCM

    1. Analysis–Autorun batch edit–select MPRPCM from the list
    2. MPRPCM: Setup
    3. Release all
    4. Enter new sample numbers, then OK–OK

  11. Reboot by Ctrl+Alt+Del

  12. Fill LN2 dewar (20L, record on the notebook)
  13. Check two tubes: ~2 cm from the end of the wood stick, then put them into the LN2 dewar
  14. Check connecting pipe
  15. Check paper
  16. Press LF/FF button twice? to feed paper forward by ~2? cm
  17. Analysis–Autorun start/stop–select MPRPCM from the list, Run

docs.title: Friday Standby
docs.text:
1. Prep–Water trap chiller off
  2. ML, AB
  3. HV
  4. Remove LN2 tubes from dewar

docs.title: Version History
docs.text: • 2024-01-11: Compiled by Xi (Sean) Chen, based on James Rolfe’s notes
